Claim: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

https://factcheck.afp.com/these-photos-show-aftermath-powerful-earthquake-croatia?check=1

Claim: It is predicted that using Turmeric can cure coronavirus in India in a newborn baby suffering from birth defects.
Explaination: The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: It is predicted that using Turmeric can cure coronavirus in India in a newborn baby suffering from birth defects.

Explanation:The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/birth-defective-baby-falsely-linked-to-coronavirus-in-ajmer/

Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
Explaination: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.

Explanation:This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-is-that-last-picture-of-indonesian-doctor-hadio-ali/

Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”
Explaination: The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”

Explanation:The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14817124

Claim: The novel coronavirus has reached Cebu province and Boracay Island, which are popular tourists destinations.
Explaination: There is no confirmed positive case of the newly-detected 2019 nCoV in the Philippines at this time. This was clarified by Health Secretary Francisco Duque III in a Jan. 27 interview with CNN Philippines. He emphasized this in a separate press conference in Malacanang, where he also reported that the five-year-old boy suspected of having the disease tested negative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus has reached Cebu province and Boracay Island, which are popular tourists destinations.

Explanation:There is no confirmed positive case of the newly-detected 2019 nCoV in the Philippines at this time. This was clarified by Health Secretary Francisco Duque III in a Jan. 27 interview with CNN Philippines. He emphasized this in a separate press conference in Malacanang, where he also reported that the five-year-old boy suspected of having the disease tested negative.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-online-posts-claiming-novel-coronaviru

Claim: Popular Cardiologist Devi Shetty talking about symptoms of COVID-19.
Explaination: The person in question is a different doctor and not the famous cardiologist.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Popular Cardiologist Devi Shetty talking about symptoms of COVID-19.

Explanation:The person in question is a different doctor and not the famous cardiologist.

https://www.boomlive.in/coronavirus-outbreak/dr-devi-shetty-did-not-record-viral-audio-clip-on-coronavirus-7275

Claim: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte orders state hospital to accept COVID-19 patients from Wuhan.
Explaination: Duterte’s speeches prior to the publication of City News’ false report have made no mention of PGH being used for Chinese patients with COVID-19. Neither have legitimate news media organizations reported on this.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte orders state hospital to accept COVID-19 patients from Wuhan.

Explanation:Duterte’s speeches prior to the publication of City News’ false report have made no mention of PGH being used for Chinese patients with COVID-19. Neither have legitimate news media organizations reported on this.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-duterte-did-not-open-pgh-wuhan-covid-1

Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.
Explaination: The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.

Explanation:The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14901149

Claim: UK, USA have asked Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to lead a task force to tackle coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no such task force that the Indian prime Minister is heading. The Indian prime minister has been a part of the G20 and SAARC summits for their discussions on coronavirus. The WION's reporting was misinterpreted.
Label: False
html:
Claim: UK, USA have asked Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to lead a task force to tackle coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no such task force that the Indian prime Minister is heading. The Indian prime minister has been a part of the G20 and SAARC summits for their discussions on coronavirus. The WION's reporting was misinterpreted.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/false-us-uk-asked-pm-modi-to-lead-18-nation-coronavirus-task-force-7475

Claim: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in the Macarthur Region of Australia.
Explaination: This story has not been reported by 7NEWS Sydney news, nor any other news outlets,(7News Sydney confirmed with us).
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in the Macarthur Region of Australia.

Explanation:This story has not been reported by 7NEWS Sydney news, nor any other news outlets,(7News Sydney confirmed with us).

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/04/there-is-no-new-confirmed-case-of-coronavirus-in-the-macarthur-region-in-australia/

Claim: China officially said the new coronavirus had “confirmed aerosol infection” and that “in short, airborne infections” were spread.
Explaination: Aerosol infections are rare and different from airborne infections.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China officially said the new coronavirus had “confirmed aerosol infection” and that “in short, airborne infections” were spread.

Explanation:Aerosol infections are rare and different from airborne infections.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china-10

Claim: Hospital is caught using a dummy in pandemic footage.
Explaination: Footage was for training on how to use ventilators.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Hospital is caught using a dummy in pandemic footage.

Explanation:Footage was for training on how to use ventilators.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-hospital-caught-red-handed-using-dummies-in-pandemic-footage.html

Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
Explaination: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”

Explanation:Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/20/facebook-posts/yes-wisconsin-only-state-where-all-republicans-opp/

Claim: Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” novel coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” novel coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/03/facebook-posts/these-plushies-do-not-commemorate-2019-novel-coron/

Claim: Chickens cause coronavirus.
Explaination: There has been no official confirmation of a link between chicken and nCov - and no source for nCov has been found as yet. However, WHO has said that they are looking into animal sources to find the origin but there is no clarity on what the animal is.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Chickens cause coronavirus.

Explanation:There has been no official confirmation of a link between chicken and nCov - and no source for nCov has been found as yet. However, WHO has said that they are looking into animal sources to find the origin but there is no clarity on what the animal is.

https://fit.thequint.com/health-news/coronavirus-cause-fact-check-chicken-not-origin

Claim: Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported.
Explaination: The label of Dettol mentioning that it kills coronavirus is not the recent strain of coronavirus. They have not tested its products for the recent novel coronavirus. Misleading post is getting viral.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported.

Explanation:The label of Dettol mentioning that it kills coronavirus is not the recent strain of coronavirus. They have not tested its products for the recent novel coronavirus. Misleading post is getting viral.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-dettol-didnt-test-the-2019-novel-coronavirus-strains-misleading-post-getting-viral/

Claim: PM Modi on 4/2/20 announced extension of a nationwide lockdown until 5/4/20.
Explaination: PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: PM Modi on 4/2/20 announced extension of a nationwide lockdown until 5/4/20.

Explanation:PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/02/pm-modi-has-announced-extension-of-nationwide-lockdown-till-4-may-2020/

Claim: A front page article by the Southern Times cautioning against travel to Kenya because of the growing number of cases in Kenya.
Explaination: The Southern Times published a post denouncing the front page, and the image appears to be a doctored version of a previous edition of the paper.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A front page article by the Southern Times cautioning against travel to Kenya because of the growing number of cases in Kenya.

Explanation:The Southern Times published a post denouncing the front page, and the image appears to be a doctored version of a previous edition of the paper.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-newspaper-front-page-cautioning-against-travel-to-kenya-due-to-covid-19-is-fake-bbb9c3bc3580?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256489-pacquiao-was-only-senator-responded-coronavirus-crisis

Claim: Politician Rahul Gandhi met a coronavirus patient in Waynad.
Explaination: The picture is from 2017.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Politician Rahul Gandhi met a coronavirus patient in Waynad.

Explanation:The picture is from 2017.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-congress-rahul-gandhi-wayanad-coronavirus-positive-patient-meeting-social-media-viral-news-1-1176156.html

Claim: A photo of a fleet of blue lorries bearing the image of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa has been shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that the lorries were distributing food during the novel coronavirus curfew.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; the photo in fact shows lorries that were used in a political initiative in 2014, more than five years before the coronavirus pandemic. Rajapaksa’s office also denied the claim, saying that authorities are pursuing legal action against those spreading the “false information”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a fleet of blue lorries bearing the image of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa has been shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that the lorries were distributing food during the novel coronavirus curfew.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; the photo in fact shows lorries that were used in a political initiative in 2014, more than five years before the coronavirus pandemic. Rajapaksa’s office also denied the claim, saying that authorities are pursuing legal action against those spreading the “false information”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-shows-trucks-branded-image-current-sri-lankan-prime-minister-were-used-2014

Claim: Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the COVID-19 pandemic
Explaination: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the COVID-19 pandemic

Explanation:The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-post-saying-italian-pm-surrendered-to-covid-19-is-fake-1660310-2020-03-27?check=3

Explaination: The product being hawked by the Genesis Church 2 is essentially bleach.
Label: No evidence
html:

Explanation:The product being hawked by the Genesis Church 2 is essentially bleach.

Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
Explaination: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

Explanation:The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

https://factcheck.afp.com/meme-does-not-show-fully-stocked-shelves-during-swine-flu-pandemic
